title: Individual fruit pies
description: These little pies are filled with a luscious fruity mix, spiked with a little alcohol. They remind me of the fruit pies my Nan used to make: a real treat, especially when served warm with whipped cream. I’ve given you three fillings to choose from; each uses the full quantity of pastry.
ingredients: 200g/7oz plain flour, plus extra for dusting
100g/3½oz unsalted butter, chilled, cut into 1cm/½in cubes
7 medium eating apples (approximately 1kg/2lb 4oz),  peeled, quartered and cored
75g/2½oz caster sugar, plus extra for dusting
7 medium pears (approximately 1kg/2lb 4oz),  peeled, quartered and cored
75g/2½oz caster sugar, plus extra for dusting
75g/2½oz caster sugar, plus extra for dusting
